# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width=10)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = String()
    
    for word in split(text, r"\s+"))
        if occursin(r"\b\w{,$text_width}}\b", word)
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = string(word, " ")
        else
            current_line *= string(word, " ")
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, current_line)  # Add the last line if not empty
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage
text = """
This is a very long sentence that we want to wrap into multiple lines with a maximum width of 10 characters per line.
"""
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text);
```
In this example, the `wrap_string` function takes a long text and wraps it into new lines, respecting the specified `text_width`.
